title: Retro Card Games
description: From Old Maid to Rummy, test your knowledge of the card games that brought families together around the kitchen table!

questions.question: In the children's card game Old Maid, what is the objective?
options: Get rid of all your cards first
Avoid being left with the unmatched Old Maid card

questions.question: The card game Go Fish is typically recommended for children of what minimum age?
In the card game War, what happens when both players flip over cards of equal value?
options: The game ends in a tie
Players declare 'War' and play additional cards

The card game Crazy Eights gets its name from the fact that eights serve what special function?
What popular card game, often played by families, requires players to shout the game's name when they have one card left?
In Bridge, how many players are needed to play a standard game?
What card game, popular in the 1940s-50s, involves matching sets and runs of cards and was named after a type of liquor?
